title: TabSINT Feature Demonstration
subtitle: This protocol is used for Human-in-the-Loop testing of TabSINT response areas.
instructionText: Refer to the TabSINT Test Procedures PDF for instructions

pages.title: Response Area Testing
pages.questionMainText: Please select a response area to test:

pages.title: Button Grid
pages.questionSubText: This page will automatically submit after 5 seconds.

pages.title: Button Grid
pages.questionSubText: Wait 5 seconds. This page should NOT submit automatically.

pages.title: Button Grid
pages.questionMainText: The correct answer is A. Please choose the correct answer.

pages.title: Button Grid
pages.questionMainText: The correct answer is A. Please choose an incorrect answer.

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: This page must have default styling.

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: Buttons that are not selected should be red. Buttons that are selected should be green.

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: Buttons that are not selected should be green. Buttons that are selected should be red.

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: Select Red. Red should be marked correct (green). Any other selected answers should be marked incorrect (red).

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: Select anything other than Red. Red should be marked correct (green). Any other selected answers should be marked incorrect (red).

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?
pages.questionSubText: Select anything other than Red. Selected answers other than Red should be marked incorrect (red), the correct answer (Red) will be shown in grey and all other answers should be faded.

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: What is your favorite color?

pages.title: Checkbox
pages.questionMainText: Do you dislike the color red?
pages.instructionText: This is a follow-on to Test Case 009

pages.title: Integer with Follow-Ons
pages.questionMainText: How many times have you been deployed to Iraq or Afghanistan?

target.title: Integer
target.questionMainText: Were you ever close enough to an explosive blast to feel the heat or pressure wave?

pages.title: Likert
pages.questionMainText: It was easy for the person to put the headset on me.

questions.questionMainText: Did you have any trouble hearing soft sounds before being exposed to noise?
Do you have any trouble hearing soft sounds RIGHT NOW?

pages.title: Modified Rhyme Test (MRT)
pages.questionMainText: The correct response is meat. Mark the correct answer.

pages.title: Modified Rhyme Test (MRT)
pages.questionMainText: The correct response is meat. Mark the correct answer.

pages.title: Svantek Background Noise Measurement
pages.questionSubText: This page uses the Svantek to record background noise. This page does not use the MPANL response area.

pages.title: Multiple Choice
pages.questionMainText: What day of the week is today?

pages.title: Multiple Choice with Set Flags
pages.questionMainText: What day of the week is today?

pages.title: Multiple Choice
pages.questionMainText: Are you working?

pages.title: Multiple Choice
pages.questionMainText: What is something you do on your day off?

pages.title: Multiple Choice With Repeats
pages.questionMainText: This page will repeat twice if you select A.

pages.title: Custom HTML and JS
pages.questionMainText: Custom Response Area

pages.title: Preprocessing Functions
pages.questionMainText: Preprocessing Functions
pages.questionSubText: You can run a pre-processing function on the test data before loading a page

pages.title: Progress Bar
pages.questionSubText: You can change the progress bar using pre-processing functions. Your response here will set the progress bar on the next page.

pages.title: Progress Bar
pages.questionSubText: The progress bar should have changed to your choice

pages.title: Multiple Choice Selection
pages.questionMainText: Mark test, three, and rows, then press Submit.

pages.title: Multiple Choice Selection
pages.questionMainText: Mark three, four, and testing, then press Submit.

pages.title: SeeSaw
pages.questionMainText: Protection vs. Distortion

responseArea.leftHeader: How well my HPD protects me from loud impulse sounds like gunfire or explosions
responseArea.rightHeader: How natural my own voice sounds while talking when wearing my HPD
leftLabels: Much less protection from loud impulse sounds
Somewhat less protection from loud impulse sounds
Somewhat more protection from loud impulse sounds
Much more protection from loud impulse sounds
rightLabels: Much more distortion of my voice
Somewhat more distortion of my voice
Somewhat more natural sound of my voice
Much more natural sound of my voice

responseArea.leftHeader: How well my HPD protects me from loud impulse sounds like gunfire or explosions
responseArea.rightHeader: How natural my own voice sounds while talking when wearing my HPD

Somewhat more protection from loud impulse sounds

rightLabels: Much more distortion of my voice

Somewhat more natural sound of my voice

pages.title: Yes-No
pages.questionMainText: Do you want to continue with the demonstration?

pages.title: Yes-No
pages.questionMainText: Do you want to continue with the demonstration?

pages.title: Feedback
pages.questionMainText: Please give us your feedback on this demonstration.
pages.questionSubText: This page is a follow-on from Test Case SRS-Yes-No-005
